title: Amor-de-burro (Bidens pilosa)
body: An annual tubuliflora plant, native to South America and perfectly naturalized in Madeira. Its upper leaves are usually 3-sect and its fruits have 2-4 rigid and twisted awns. It is widely used in the fields as an emmenagogue, and is also known as setas and malpica.

South America: Region of origin of the plant
